clean_content:
Definition / general

* May arise from epithelial lining of an odontogenic cyst or *de novo* from intraosseous odontogenic rests* Mean age is 52 years (range 4 to 76 years); 70% occur in men ([Int J Oral Maxillofac Surg 2001;30:349](11518362)); most tumors (92%) occur in mandible* Progressive swelling of the jaw, pain and loosening of the teeth* Cervical nodal metastases are common* Aggressive behavior (4 year survival is 40%)

Radiology description

* Radiolucent cystic-like pattern of bone destruction but with well defined margins

Radiology images

Images hosted on PathOut server:  

[![Missing Image](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/caseofweek/case200773image1.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/caseofweek/case200773image1.jpg)

Lytic and cystic lesion involving right mandible

Case reports

* 66 year old man with enlargement of mandible ([Case of Week #73](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/caseofweek/case200773.htm))* Primary intraosseous verrucous carcinoma developing from a maxillary odontogenic cyst ([Tumori 2001;87:444](11989603))* Verrucous carcinoma arising in an odontogenic cyst ([Oral Surg Oral Med Oral Pathol 1980;49:151](6928287))

Treatment

* Aggressive surgical excision ([Oral Surg Oral Med Oral Pathol Oral Radiol Endod 2007;103:e29](17095253))* Possibly with postoperative radiotherapy

Microscopic (histologic) description

* Usually squamous cell carcinoma, high grade

Microscopic (histologic) images

Contributed by Kelly Magliocca, D.D.S., M.P.H.  

[![Primary intraosseous carcinoma, NOS](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/mandiblemaxillawhoMagliocca2.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/mandiblemaxillawhoMagliocca2.jpg)

Primary intraosseous carcinoma, NOS
